02X.F.summary: Xanadu Mines Limited engages in the exploration and development of various mineral exploration projects in Mongolia. The company primarily explores for copper and gold deposits. Its flagship project is the Kharmagtai copper-gold project located in Omnogovi province. The company was founded in 2005 and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.

0975.HK.summary: Mongolian Mining Corporation engages in the mining, processing, transportation, and sale of coking coal products. The company owns and operates the Ukhaa Khudag and the Baruun Naran open-pit coking coal mines located in South Gobi province of Mongolia. It also engages in the railway project management, airport operation and management, water exploration and supply management, and power supply project management activities; and trading of coal and machinery equipment. The company sells its products primarily in China. Mongolian Mining Corporation was incorporated in 2010 and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.

2J9.F.summary: Steppe Gold Ltd. explores for and develops precious metals in Mongolia and Canada. Its principal project is the Altan Tsagaan Ovoo gold and silver project comprising one mining license covering an area of approximately 5,492.63 hectares located in the territory of Tsagaan Ovoo soum, Dornod province of Eastern Mongolia. The company was incorporated in 2016 and is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.

5D5.F.summary: Aranjin Resources Ltd., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration and development of copper projects. Its flagship asset is the Baruun Tal Copper Project located in the World Class South Gobi Porphyry Copper Province. The company was formerly known as Five Star Diamonds Limited and changed its name to Aranjin Resources Ltd. in June 2020. Aranjin Resources Ltd. is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.

600988.SS.short_name: CHIFENG JILONG GOLD MINING CO L
600988.SS.summary: The company's main business is gold, non-ferrous metal mining and selection and comprehensive resource recycling business, which is mainly carried out through its subsidiaries. Subsidiaries Geelong Mining, Huatai Mining, and Wulong Gold are engaged in gold mining and dressing business; subsidiary Hanfeng Mining is engaged in zinc, lead, copper, and molybdenum mining and dressing business; Vientiane Mining in Laos is currently mainly engaged in copper mining and smelting, and has The production of the gold mine will be restarted in May 2020; Xiongfeng Environmental Protection and Guangyuan Technology are both in the comprehensive resource recycling industry, Xiongfeng Environmental Protection is engaged in the comprehensive recycling and utilization of non-ferrous metal resources, and Guangyuan Technology is engaged in the processing of waste electrical and electronic products. The company has established a development strategy of "focusing on mining and focusing on gold mining business" to stabilize the main gold mining business and intends to divest non-mining business.

ARJN.V.summary: Aranjin Resources Ltd., together with its subsidiaries, engages in the exploration and development of copper projects. Its flagship asset is the Baruun Tal Copper Project located in the World Class South Gobi Porphyry Copper Province. The company was formerly known as Five Star Diamonds Limited and changed its name to Aranjin Resources Ltd. in June 2020. Aranjin Resources Ltd. is headquartered in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia.
